üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import re "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter "keyword">from itertools "keyword">import permutations "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== COMPREHENSIVE SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM SOLVER ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find the original Shakespeare line by systematic anagram analysis') print() # Load our previous analysis results to understand what we're working "keyword">with analysis_file = "keyword">None workspace_files = [] # First, inspect workspace structure safely print(&#x27;üìÅ INSPECTING WORKSPACE FOR ANALYSIS FILES:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for item "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): item_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', item) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(item_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(item_path) workspace_files.append((item, item_path, file_size)) print(f&#x27; üìÑ {item} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Look "keyword">for our analysis results file "keyword">if &#x27;anagram_analysis_results.json' "keyword">in item: analysis_file = item_path print(f&#x27; üéØ Found analysis results file!') "keyword">elif os.path.isdir(item_path): print(f&#x27; üìÅ {item}/') "keyword">for subitem "keyword">in os.listdir(item_path): subitem_path = os.path.join(item_path, subitem) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(subitem_path): subfile_size = os.path.getsize(subitem_path) workspace_files.append((f&#x27;{item}/{subitem}', subitem_path, subfile_size)) print(f&#x27; üìÑ {subitem} ({subfile_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if &#x27;anagram_analysis_results.json' "keyword">in subitem: analysis_file = subitem_path print(f&#x27; üéØ Found analysis results file!') # Load our previous analysis anagram_data = "keyword">None "keyword">if analysis_file: print(f&#x27;\nüìä LOADING PREVIOUS ANALYSIS:') print(f&#x27;File: {analysis_file}') # Safely inspect the JSON structure first "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: anagram_data = json.load(f) print(f&#x27;‚úÖ Analysis data loaded successfully') print(f&#x27;Available keys: {list(anagram_data.keys())}') # Inspect structure "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in anagram_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, str): print(f&#x27; {key}: <string, {len(value)} chars>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: <dict, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: <list, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value)} = {value}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error loading analysis: {e}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No previous analysis file found') # Extract the key information we need "keyword">if anagram_data: anagram_text = anagram_data.get(&#x27;anagram_source_text', '') letters_only = anagram_data.get(&#x27;letters_only', '') letter_frequency = anagram_data.get(&#x27;letter_frequency', {}) total_letters = anagram_data.get(&#x27;total_letters', 0) print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ EXTRACTED ANAGRAM DATA:') print(f&#x27;Source text: "{anagram_text}"') print(f&#x27;Letters only: "{letters_only}"') print(f&#x27;Total letters: {total_letters}') print(f&#x27;Letter frequency available: {bool(letter_frequency)}') "keyword">else: # Fallback to the known text "keyword">from HISTORY "keyword">if analysis file "keyword">not found print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Using fallback anagram text "keyword">from HISTORY:') anagram_text = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" clean_text = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', anagram_text) letters_only = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_text).upper() letter_frequency = dict(Counter(letters_only)) total_letters = len(letters_only) print(f&#x27;Source text: "{anagram_text}"') print(f&#x27;Letters only: "{letters_only}"') print(f&#x27;Total letters: {total_letters}') print(f&#x27;\nüìä LETTER FREQUENCY ANALYSIS:') "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in sorted(letter_frequency.items()): print(f&#x27; {letter}: {count}') # Now let's "keyword">try a more comprehensive approach to find Shakespeare lines print(f&#x27;\nüé≠ EXPANDED SHAKESPEARE LINE SEARCH:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for longer Shakespeare passages that might match our 100-letter count...') # Extended list of Shakespeare quotes, focusing on longer passages extended_shakespeare_lines = [ # From Hamlet &#x27;To be "keyword">or "keyword">not to be that "keyword">is the question whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer', &#x27;Whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer the slings "keyword">and arrows of outrageous fortune', &#x27;Or to take arms against a sea of troubles "keyword">and by opposing end them', &#x27;To die to sleep no more "keyword">and by a sleep to say we end the heartache', &#x27;What dreams may come when we have shuffled off this mortal coil must give us pause', &#x27;The undiscovered country "keyword">from whose bourn no traveler returns puzzles the will', &#x27;Thus conscience does make cowards of us all "keyword">and thus the native hue of resolution', &#x27;Is sicklied oer "keyword">with the pale cast of thought "keyword">and enterprises of great pith "keyword">and moment', &#x27;Something "keyword">is rotten "keyword">in the state of Denmark', &#x27;The lady doth protest too much methinks', &#x27;There are more things "keyword">in heaven "keyword">and earth Horatio than are dreamt of "keyword">in your philosophy', &#x27;This above all to thine own self be true "keyword">and it must follow "keyword">as the night the day', &#x27;Neither a borrower nor a lender be "keyword">for loan oft loses both itself "keyword">and friend', &#x27;Brevity "keyword">is the soul of wit', &#x27;Though this be madness yet there "keyword">is method "keyword">in it', &#x27;The rest "keyword">is silence', # From other plays &#x27;All the worlds a stage "keyword">and all the men "keyword">and women merely players they have their exits "keyword">and their entrances', &#x27;Now "keyword">is the winter of our discontent made glorious summer by this son of York', &#x27;A horse a horse my kingdom "keyword">for a horse', &#x27;If music be the food of love play on give me excess of it that surfeiting', &#x27;We are such stuff "keyword">as dreams are made on "keyword">and our little life "keyword">is rounded "keyword">with a sleep', &#x27;The course of true love never did run smooth', &#x27;Lord what fools these mortals be', &#x27;Double double toil "keyword">and trouble fire burn "keyword">and cauldron bubble', &#x27;Fair "keyword">is foul "keyword">and foul "keyword">is fair hover through the fog "keyword">and filthy air', &#x27;Is this a dagger which I see before me the handle toward my hand', &#x27;Out out brief candle lifes but a walking shadow a poor player', &#x27;Tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow creeps "keyword">in this petty pace "keyword">from day to day', &#x27;Friends Romans countrymen lend me your ears I come to bury Caesar "keyword">not to praise him', &#x27;Et tu Brute then fall Caesar', &#x27;The evil that men do lives after them the good "keyword">is oft interred "keyword">with their bones', &#x27;Cowards die many times before their deaths the valiant never taste of death but once', # Longer composite quotes that might match &#x27;To be "keyword">or "keyword">not to be that "keyword">is the question whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer the slings "keyword">and arrows', &#x27;All the worlds a stage "keyword">and all the men "keyword">and women merely players they have their exits "keyword">and entrances "keyword">and one man "keyword">in his time plays many parts', &#x27;If music be the food of love play on give me excess of it that surfeiting the appetite may sicken "keyword">and so die', &#x27;Tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow creeps "keyword">in this petty pace "keyword">from day to day to the last syllable of recorded time', &#x27;Now "keyword">is the winter of our discontent made glorious summer by this son of York "keyword">and all the clouds that lowered upon our house', &#x27;Double double toil "keyword">and trouble fire burn "keyword">and cauldron bubble fillet of a fenny snake "keyword">in the cauldron boil "keyword">and bake', &#x27;There are more things "keyword">in heaven "keyword">and earth Horatio than are dreamt of "keyword">in your philosophy', &#x27;This above all to thine own self be true "keyword">and it must follow "keyword">as the night the day thou canst "keyword">not then be false to any man' ] print(f&#x27;Testing {len(extended_shakespeare_lines)} extended Shakespeare lines...') matching_candidates = [] best_partial_matches = [] "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(extended_shakespeare_lines, 1): # Clean the Shakespeare line clean_shakespeare = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', line) shakespeare_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_shakespeare).upper() shakespeare_counts = Counter(shakespeare_letters) print(f&#x27;\n{i:2d}. "{line[:60]}..." ({len(line)} chars)') print(f&#x27; Letters: {len(shakespeare_letters)} (target: {total_letters})') # Check "keyword">for exact match "keyword">if shakespeare_counts == Counter(letters_only): matching_candidates.append({ &#x27;line': line, &#x27;clean_line': clean_shakespeare, &#x27;letter_count': len(shakespeare_letters), &#x27;match_type': 'perfect' }) print(f&#x27; *** PERFECT ANAGRAM MATCH FOUND! ***') # Check "keyword">for same letter count (potential match "keyword">with different letters) "keyword">elif len(shakespeare_letters) == total_letters: # Calculate similarity score common_letters = sum((Counter(letters_only) & shakespeare_counts).values()) similarity_score = common_letters / total_letters best_partial_matches.append({ &#x27;line': line, &#x27;clean_line': clean_shakespeare, &#x27;letter_count': len(shakespeare_letters), &#x27;similarity_score': similarity_score, &#x27;match_type': 'same_length' }) print(f&#x27; Same length! Similarity: {similarity_score:.2%}') "keyword">if similarity_score > 0.8: # High similarity print(f&#x27; *** HIGH SIMILARITY MATCH! ***') # Show letter differences missing = Counter(letters_only) - shakespeare_counts extra = shakespeare_counts - Counter(letters_only) "keyword">if missing: print(f&#x27; Missing: {dict(missing)}') "keyword">if extra: print(f&#x27; Extra: {dict(extra)}') # Also check "keyword">if it's close "keyword">in length (within 10 letters) "keyword">elif abs(len(shakespeare_letters) - total_letters) <= 10: similarity_score = sum((Counter(letters_only) & shakespeare_counts).values()) / max(len(shakespeare_letters), total_letters) "keyword">if similarity_score > 0.7: best_partial_matches.append({ &#x27;line': line, &#x27;clean_line': clean_shakespeare, &#x27;letter_count': len(shakespeare_letters), &#x27;similarity_score': similarity_score, &#x27;match_type': 'close_length' }) print(f&#x27; Close length, good similarity: {similarity_score:.2%}') print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ SEARCH RESULTS:') print(&#x27;=' * 40) print(f&#x27;Perfect matches found: {len(matching_candidates)}') print(f&#x27;Partial matches found: {len(best_partial_matches)}') "keyword">if matching_candidates: print(f&#x27;\n*** PERFECT ANAGRAM MATCHES ***') "keyword">for i, candidate "keyword">in enumerate(matching_candidates, 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. "{candidate["line"]}"') print(f&#x27; Letters: {candidate["letter_count"]}') print(f&#x27; Type: {candidate["match_type"]}') # Verify this "keyword">is actually an anagram by checking letter frequency candidate_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', re.sub(r'[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', candidate['line'])).upper() print(f&#x27; Verification: {Counter(candidate_letters) == Counter(letters_only)}') "keyword">if best_partial_matches: # Sort by similarity score best_partial_matches.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;similarity_score'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;\n*** TOP PARTIAL MATCHES (by similarity) ***') "keyword">for i, candidate "keyword">in enumerate(best_partial_matches[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f&#x27;{i}. "{candidate["line"][:80]}..."') print(f&#x27; Letters: {candidate["letter_count"]} (target: {total_letters})') print(f&#x27; Similarity: {candidate["similarity_score"]:.2%}') print(f&#x27; Type: {candidate["match_type"]}') # If no perfect matches, let's "keyword">try a different approach "keyword">if "keyword">not matching_candidates: print(f&#x27;\nüîç ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: MANUAL ANAGRAM SOLVING') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Since no direct matches found, let\'s analyze the anagram more systematically...') # Look "keyword">for common Shakespeare words "keyword">in our letter set print(f&#x27;\nüìù ANALYZING LETTER PATTERNS:') # Common Shakespeare words "keyword">and their letter counts shakespeare_words = { &#x27;THE': 3, 'AND': 3, 'TO': 2, 'OF': 2, 'A': 1, 'IN': 2, 'IS': 2, 'IT': 2, &#x27;THAT': 4, 'BE': 2, 'FOR': 3, 'NOT': 3, 'WITH': 4, 'AS': 2, 'BUT': 3, &#x27;THOU': 4, 'THY': 3, 'THEE': 4, 'MINE': 4, 'LOVE': 4, 'HEART': 5, &#x27;LIFE': 4, 'DEATH': 5, 'TIME': 4, 'WORLD': 5, 'MAN': 3, 'SWEET': 5, &#x27;FAIR': 4, 'TRUE': 4, 'GOOD': 4, 'GREAT': 5, 'NOBLE': 5, 'HONOR': 5, &#x27;HEAVEN': 6, 'EARTH': 5, 'NATURE': 6, 'FORTUNE': 7, 'VIRTUE': 6 } # Check which common words we can potentially form available_letters = Counter(letters_only) possible_words = [] "keyword">for word, length "keyword">in shakespeare_words.items(): word_letters = Counter(word) # Check "keyword">if we have enough letters to form this word "keyword">if all(available_letters[letter] >= count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in word_letters.items()): possible_words.append(word) print(f&#x27;Possible Shakespeare words "keyword">from available letters:') "keyword">for word "keyword">in sorted(possible_words): print(f&#x27; {word}') # Try to identify potential key phrases print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LOOKING FOR KEY SHAKESPEARE PHRASES:') # The anagram mentions Hamlet, so let's focus on Hamlet quotes hamlet_focus_words = [&#x27;HAMLET', 'DENMARK', 'PRINCE', 'FATHER', 'GHOST', 'REVENGE', 'MADNESS', 'OPHELIA'] print(&#x27;Checking "keyword">for Hamlet-related words:') "keyword">for word "keyword">in hamlet_focus_words: word_letters = Counter(word) can_form = all(available_letters[letter] >= count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in word_letters.items()) print(f&#x27; {word}: {"‚úì" "keyword">if can_form "keyword">else "‚úó"}') # Given the complexity, let's save our progress "keyword">and suggest manual analysis print(f&#x27;\nüí° MANUAL ANALYSIS SUGGESTION:') print(&#x27;The anagram "keyword">is quite complex. Here are some approaches to "keyword">try:') print(&#x27;1. Focus on the fact that it mentions "Hamlet" - likely "keyword">from Hamlet') print(&#x27;2. Look "keyword">for the pattern "TO BE OR NOT TO BE" "keyword">or similar famous Hamlet lines') print(&#x27;3. The phrase "how life turns rotten" might relate to "Something "keyword">is rotten "keyword">in the state of Denmark"') print(&#x27;4. Try online anagram solvers "keyword">with the 100-letter string') print(&#x27;5. Consider that punctuation "keyword">and spacing "keyword">in the original might differ') # Save comprehensive results results = { &#x27;anagram_source': anagram_text, &#x27;letters_analyzed': letters_only, &#x27;total_letters': total_letters, &#x27;letter_frequency': letter_frequency, &#x27;shakespeare_lines_tested': len(extended_shakespeare_lines), &#x27;perfect_matches': matching_candidates, &#x27;partial_matches': best_partial_matches[:10], # Top 10 partial matches &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Try online anagram solvers', &#x27;Focus on Hamlet quotes specifically', &#x27;Consider punctuation variations', &#x27;Manual rearrangement of common Shakespeare phrases' ] } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/comprehensive_anagram_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(results, f, indent=2) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ Comprehensive analysis saved to: workspace/comprehensive_anagram_analysis.json') # Create a summary "keyword">for the user "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/anagram_solution_summary.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(&#x27;SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM ANALYSIS SUMMARY\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 50 + '\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;ANAGRAM TEXT TO SOLVE:\n') f.write(f&#x27;"{anagram_text}"\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;LETTERS ONLY (100 total): {letters_only}\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;ANALYSIS RESULTS:\n') f.write(f&#x27;- Tested {len(extended_shakespeare_lines)} Shakespeare lines\n') f.write(f&#x27;- Perfect matches found: {len(matching_candidates)}\n') f.write(f&#x27;- Partial matches found: {len(best_partial_matches)}\n\n') "keyword">if matching_candidates: f.write(&#x27;PERFECT MATCHES:\n') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(matching_candidates, 1): f.write(f&#x27;{i}. "{match["line"]}"\n') f.write(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if best_partial_matches: f.write(&#x27;TOP PARTIAL MATCHES:\n') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(best_partial_matches[:5], 1): f.write(f&#x27;{i}. "{match["line"][:60]}..." (similarity: {match["similarity_score"]:.1%})\n') f.write(&#x27;\n') f.write(&#x27;RECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:\n') "keyword">for step "keyword">in results[&#x27;next_steps']: f.write(f&#x27;- {step}\n') print(f&#x27;Summary saved to: workspace/anagram_solution_summary.txt') print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===') "keyword">if matching_candidates: print(f&#x27;‚úÖ Found {len(matching_candidates)} perfect match(es)!') print(f&#x27;The original Shakespeare line "keyword">is likely:') "keyword">for match "keyword">in matching_candidates: print(f&#x27; "{match["line"]}"') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ö†Ô∏è No perfect matches found "keyword">in current database.') print(f&#x27;The original line may require:') print(f&#x27; - More extensive Shakespeare quote database') print(f&#x27; - Online anagram solver tools') print(f&#x27; - Manual rearrangement analysis') print(f&#x27; - Focus on specific plays (especially Hamlet)') print(f&#x27;\n*** COMPREHENSIVE SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***')

The analysis suggests the solution may require online anagram solvers, more extensive Shakespeare databases, or manual rearrangement of the 100-letter string 'INONEOFTHEBARDSBESTTHOUGHTOFTRAGEDIESAREINSISTENTHEROHAMLETQUERIESONTWOFRONTSABOUTHOWLIFETURNSROTTEN'. üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import re "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter "keyword">from itertools "keyword">import permutations "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== COMPREHENSIVE SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM SOLVER ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Find the original Shakespeare line by systematic anagram analysis') print() # Load our previous analysis results to understand what we're working "keyword">with analysis_file = "keyword">None workspace_files = [] # First, inspect workspace structure safely print(&#x27;üìÅ INSPECTING WORKSPACE FOR ANALYSIS FILES:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for item "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): item_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', item) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(item_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(item_path) workspace_files.append((item, item_path, file_size)) print(f&#x27; üìÑ {item} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Look "keyword">for our analysis results file "keyword">if &#x27;anagram_analysis_results.json' "keyword">in item: analysis_file = item_path print(f&#x27; üéØ Found analysis results file!') "keyword">elif os.path.isdir(item_path): print(f&#x27; üìÅ {item}/') "keyword">for subitem "keyword">in os.listdir(item_path): subitem_path = os.path.join(item_path, subitem) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(subitem_path): subfile_size = os.path.getsize(subitem_path) workspace_files.append((f&#x27;{item}/{subitem}', subitem_path, subfile_size)) print(f&#x27; üìÑ {subitem} ({subfile_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if &#x27;anagram_analysis_results.json' "keyword">in subitem: analysis_file = subitem_path print(f&#x27; üéØ Found analysis results file!') # Load our previous analysis anagram_data = "keyword">None "keyword">if analysis_file: print(f&#x27;\nüìä LOADING PREVIOUS ANALYSIS:') print(f&#x27;File: {analysis_file}') # Safely inspect the JSON structure first "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: anagram_data = json.load(f) print(f&#x27;‚úÖ Analysis data loaded successfully') print(f&#x27;Available keys: {list(anagram_data.keys())}') # Inspect structure "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in anagram_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, str): print(f&#x27; {key}: <string, {len(value)} chars>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: <dict, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: <list, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value)} = {value}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error loading analysis: {e}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No previous analysis file found') # Extract the key information we need "keyword">if anagram_data: anagram_text = anagram_data.get(&#x27;anagram_source_text', '') letters_only = anagram_data.get(&#x27;letters_only', '') letter_frequency = anagram_data.get(&#x27;letter_frequency', {}) total_letters = anagram_data.get(&#x27;total_letters', 0) print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ EXTRACTED ANAGRAM DATA:') print(f&#x27;Source text: "{anagram_text}"') print(f&#x27;Letters only: "{letters_only}"') print(f&#x27;Total letters: {total_letters}') print(f&#x27;Letter frequency available: {bool(letter_frequency)}') "keyword">else: # Fallback to the known text "keyword">from HISTORY "keyword">if analysis file "keyword">not found print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Using fallback anagram text "keyword">from HISTORY:') anagram_text = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" clean_text = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', anagram_text) letters_only = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_text).upper() letter_frequency = dict(Counter(letters_only)) total_letters = len(letters_only) print(f&#x27;Source text: "{anagram_text}"') print(f&#x27;Letters only: "{letters_only}"') print(f&#x27;Total letters: {total_letters}') print(f&#x27;\nüìä LETTER FREQUENCY ANALYSIS:') "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in sorted(letter_frequency.items()): print(f&#x27; {letter}: {count}') # Now let's "keyword">try a more comprehensive approach to find Shakespeare lines print(f&#x27;\nüé≠ EXPANDED SHAKESPEARE LINE SEARCH:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for longer Shakespeare passages that might match our 100-letter count...') # Extended list of Shakespeare quotes, focusing on longer passages extended_shakespeare_lines = [ # From Hamlet &#x27;To be "keyword">or "keyword">not to be that "keyword">is the question whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer', &#x27;Whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer the slings "keyword">and arrows of outrageous fortune', &#x27;Or to take arms against a sea of troubles "keyword">and by opposing end them', &#x27;To die to sleep no more "keyword">and by a sleep to say we end the heartache', &#x27;What dreams may come when we have shuffled off this mortal coil must give us pause', &#x27;The undiscovered country "keyword">from whose bourn no traveler returns puzzles the will', &#x27;Thus conscience does make cowards of us all "keyword">and thus the native hue of resolution', &#x27;Is sicklied oer "keyword">with the pale cast of thought "keyword">and enterprises of great pith "keyword">and moment', &#x27;Something "keyword">is rotten "keyword">in the state of Denmark', &#x27;The lady doth protest too much methinks', &#x27;There are more things "keyword">in heaven "keyword">and earth Horatio than are dreamt of "keyword">in your philosophy', &#x27;This above all to thine own self be true "keyword">and it must follow "keyword">as the night the day', &#x27;Neither a borrower nor a lender be "keyword">for loan oft loses both itself "keyword">and friend', &#x27;Brevity "keyword">is the soul of wit', &#x27;Though this be madness yet there "keyword">is method "keyword">in it', &#x27;The rest "keyword">is silence', # From other plays &#x27;All the worlds a stage "keyword">and all the men "keyword">and women merely players they have their exits "keyword">and their entrances', &#x27;Now "keyword">is the winter of our discontent made glorious summer by this son of York', &#x27;A horse a horse my kingdom "keyword">for a horse', &#x27;If music be the food of love play on give me excess of it that surfeiting', &#x27;We are such stuff "keyword">as dreams are made on "keyword">and our little life "keyword">is rounded "keyword">with a sleep', &#x27;The course of true love never did run smooth', &#x27;Lord what fools these mortals be', &#x27;Double double toil "keyword">and trouble fire burn "keyword">and cauldron bubble', &#x27;Fair "keyword">is foul "keyword">and foul "keyword">is fair hover through the fog "keyword">and filthy air', &#x27;Is this a dagger which I see before me the handle toward my hand', &#x27;Out out brief candle lifes but a walking shadow a poor player', &#x27;Tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow creeps "keyword">in this petty pace "keyword">from day to day', &#x27;Friends Romans countrymen lend me your ears I come to bury Caesar "keyword">not to praise him', &#x27;Et tu Brute then fall Caesar', &#x27;The evil that men do lives after them the good "keyword">is oft interred "keyword">with their bones', &#x27;Cowards die many times before their deaths the valiant never taste of death but once', # Longer composite quotes that might match &#x27;To be "keyword">or "keyword">not to be that "keyword">is the question whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer the slings "keyword">and arrows', &#x27;All the worlds a stage "keyword">and all the men "keyword">and women merely players they have their exits "keyword">and entrances "keyword">and one man "keyword">in his time plays many parts', &#x27;If music be the food of love play on give me excess of it that surfeiting the appetite may sicken "keyword">and so die', &#x27;Tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow "keyword">and tomorrow creeps "keyword">in this petty pace "keyword">from day to day to the last syllable of recorded time', &#x27;Now "keyword">is the winter of our discontent made glorious summer by this son of York "keyword">and all the clouds that lowered upon our house', &#x27;Double double toil "keyword">and trouble fire burn "keyword">and cauldron bubble fillet of a fenny snake "keyword">in the cauldron boil "keyword">and bake', &#x27;There are more things "keyword">in heaven "keyword">and earth Horatio than are dreamt of "keyword">in your philosophy', &#x27;This above all to thine own self be true "keyword">and it must follow "keyword">as the night the day thou canst "keyword">not then be false to any man' ] print(f&#x27;Testing {len(extended_shakespeare_lines)} extended Shakespeare lines...') matching_candidates = [] best_partial_matches = [] "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(extended_shakespeare_lines, 1): # Clean the Shakespeare line clean_shakespeare = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', line) shakespeare_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_shakespeare).upper() shakespeare_counts = Counter(shakespeare_letters) print(f&#x27;\n{i:2d}. "{line[:60]}..." ({len(line)} chars)') print(f&#x27; Letters: {len(shakespeare_letters)} (target: {total_letters})') # Check "keyword">for exact match "keyword">if shakespeare_counts == Counter(letters_only): matching_candidates.append({ &#x27;line': line, &#x27;clean_line': clean_shakespeare, &#x27;letter_count': len(shakespeare_letters), &#x27;match_type': 'perfect' }) print(f&#x27; *** PERFECT ANAGRAM MATCH FOUND! ***') # Check "keyword">for same letter count (potential match "keyword">with different letters) "keyword">elif len(shakespeare_letters) == total_letters: # Calculate similarity score common_letters = sum((Counter(letters_only) & shakespeare_counts).values()) similarity_score = common_letters / total_letters best_partial_matches.append({ &#x27;line': line, &#x27;clean_line': clean_shakespeare, &#x27;letter_count': len(shakespeare_letters), &#x27;similarity_score': similarity_score, &#x27;match_type': 'same_length' }) print(f&#x27; Same length! Similarity: {similarity_score:.2%}') "keyword">if similarity_score > 0.8: # High similarity print(f&#x27; *** HIGH SIMILARITY MATCH! ***') # Show letter differences missing = Counter(letters_only) - shakespeare_counts extra = shakespeare_counts - Counter(letters_only) "keyword">if missing: print(f&#x27; Missing: {dict(missing)}') "keyword">if extra: print(f&#x27; Extra: {dict(extra)}') # Also check "keyword">if it's close "keyword">in length (within 10 letters) "keyword">elif abs(len(shakespeare_letters) - total_letters) <= 10: similarity_score = sum((Counter(letters_only) & shakespeare_counts).values()) / max(len(shakespeare_letters), total_letters) "keyword">if similarity_score > 0.7: best_partial_matches.append({ &#x27;line': line, &#x27;clean_line': clean_shakespeare, &#x27;letter_count': len(shakespeare_letters), &#x27;similarity_score': similarity_score, &#x27;match_type': 'close_length' }) print(f&#x27; Close length, good similarity: {similarity_score:.2%}') print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ SEARCH RESULTS:') print(&#x27;=' * 40) print(f&#x27;Perfect matches found: {len(matching_candidates)}') print(f&#x27;Partial matches found: {len(best_partial_matches)}') "keyword">if matching_candidates: print(f&#x27;\n*** PERFECT ANAGRAM MATCHES ***') "keyword">for i, candidate "keyword">in enumerate(matching_candidates, 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. "{candidate["line"]}"') print(f&#x27; Letters: {candidate["letter_count"]}') print(f&#x27; Type: {candidate["match_type"]}') # Verify this "keyword">is actually an anagram by checking letter frequency candidate_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', re.sub(r'[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', candidate['line'])).upper() print(f&#x27; Verification: {Counter(candidate_letters) == Counter(letters_only)}') "keyword">if best_partial_matches: # Sort by similarity score best_partial_matches.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;similarity_score'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;\n*** TOP PARTIAL MATCHES (by similarity) ***') "keyword">for i, candidate "keyword">in enumerate(best_partial_matches[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f&#x27;{i}. "{candidate["line"][:80]}..."') print(f&#x27; Letters: {candidate["letter_count"]} (target: {total_letters})') print(f&#x27; Similarity: {candidate["similarity_score"]:.2%}') print(f&#x27; Type: {candidate["match_type"]}') # If no perfect matches, let's "keyword">try a different approach "keyword">if "keyword">not matching_candidates: print(f&#x27;\nüîç ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: MANUAL ANAGRAM SOLVING') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Since no direct matches found, let\'s analyze the anagram more systematically...') # Look "keyword">for common Shakespeare words "keyword">in our letter set print(f&#x27;\nüìù ANALYZING LETTER PATTERNS:') # Common Shakespeare words "keyword">and their letter counts shakespeare_words = { &#x27;THE': 3, 'AND': 3, 'TO': 2, 'OF': 2, 'A': 1, 'IN': 2, 'IS': 2, 'IT': 2, &#x27;THAT': 4, 'BE': 2, 'FOR': 3, 'NOT': 3, 'WITH': 4, 'AS': 2, 'BUT': 3, &#x27;THOU': 4, 'THY': 3, 'THEE': 4, 'MINE': 4, 'LOVE': 4, 'HEART': 5, &#x27;LIFE': 4, 'DEATH': 5, 'TIME': 4, 'WORLD': 5, 'MAN': 3, 'SWEET': 5, &#x27;FAIR': 4, 'TRUE': 4, 'GOOD': 4, 'GREAT': 5, 'NOBLE': 5, 'HONOR': 5, &#x27;HEAVEN': 6, 'EARTH': 5, 'NATURE': 6, 'FORTUNE': 7, 'VIRTUE': 6 } # Check which common words we can potentially form available_letters = Counter(letters_only) possible_words = [] "keyword">for word, length "keyword">in shakespeare_words.items(): word_letters = Counter(word) # Check "keyword">if we have enough letters to form this word "keyword">if all(available_letters[letter] >= count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in word_letters.items()): possible_words.append(word) print(f&#x27;Possible Shakespeare words "keyword">from available letters:') "keyword">for word "keyword">in sorted(possible_words): print(f&#x27; {word}') # Try to identify potential key phrases print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LOOKING FOR KEY SHAKESPEARE PHRASES:') # The anagram mentions Hamlet, so let's focus on Hamlet quotes hamlet_focus_words = [&#x27;HAMLET', 'DENMARK', 'PRINCE', 'FATHER', 'GHOST', 'REVENGE', 'MADNESS', 'OPHELIA'] print(&#x27;Checking "keyword">for Hamlet-related words:') "keyword">for word "keyword">in hamlet_focus_words: word_letters = Counter(word) can_form = all(available_letters[letter] >= count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in word_letters.items()) print(f&#x27; {word}: {"‚úì" "keyword">if can_form "keyword">else "‚úó"}') # Given the complexity, let's save our progress "keyword">and suggest manual analysis print(f&#x27;\nüí° MANUAL ANALYSIS SUGGESTION:') print(&#x27;The anagram "keyword">is quite complex. Here are some approaches to "keyword">try:') print(&#x27;1. Focus on the fact that it mentions "Hamlet" - likely "keyword">from Hamlet') print(&#x27;2. Look "keyword">for the pattern "TO BE OR NOT TO BE" "keyword">or similar famous Hamlet lines') print(&#x27;3. The phrase "how life turns rotten" might relate to "Something "keyword">is rotten "keyword">in the state of Denmark"') print(&#x27;4. Try online anagram solvers "keyword">with the 100-letter string') print(&#x27;5. Consider that punctuation "keyword">and spacing "keyword">in the original might differ') # Save comprehensive results results = { &#x27;anagram_source': anagram_text, &#x27;letters_analyzed': letters_only, &#x27;total_letters': total_letters, &#x27;letter_frequency': letter_frequency, &#x27;shakespeare_lines_tested': len(extended_shakespeare_lines), &#x27;perfect_matches': matching_candidates, &#x27;partial_matches': best_partial_matches[:10], # Top 10 partial matches &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;next_steps': [ &#x27;Try online anagram solvers', &#x27;Focus on Hamlet quotes specifically', &#x27;Consider punctuation variations', &#x27;Manual rearrangement of common Shakespeare phrases' ] } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/comprehensive_anagram_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(results, f, indent=2) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ Comprehensive analysis saved to: workspace/comprehensive_anagram_analysis.json') # Create a summary "keyword">for the user "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/anagram_solution_summary.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(&#x27;SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM ANALYSIS SUMMARY\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 50 + '\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;ANAGRAM TEXT TO SOLVE:\n') f.write(f&#x27;"{anagram_text}"\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;LETTERS ONLY (100 total): {letters_only}\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;ANALYSIS RESULTS:\n') f.write(f&#x27;- Tested {len(extended_shakespeare_lines)} Shakespeare lines\n') f.write(f&#x27;- Perfect matches found: {len(matching_candidates)}\n') f.write(f&#x27;- Partial matches found: {len(best_partial_matches)}\n\n') "keyword">if matching_candidates: f.write(&#x27;PERFECT MATCHES:\n') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(matching_candidates, 1): f.write(f&#x27;{i}. "{match["line"]}"\n') f.write(&#x27;\n') "keyword">if best_partial_matches: f.write(&#x27;TOP PARTIAL MATCHES:\n') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(best_partial_matches[:5], 1): f.write(f&#x27;{i}. "{match["line"][:60]}..." (similarity: {match["similarity_score"]:.1%})\n') f.write(&#x27;\n') f.write(&#x27;RECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:\n') "keyword">for step "keyword">in results[&#x27;next_steps']: f.write(f&#x27;- {step}\n') print(f&#x27;Summary saved to: workspace/anagram_solution_summary.txt') print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===') "keyword">if matching_candidates: print(f&#x27;‚úÖ Found {len(matching_candidates)} perfect match(es)!') print(f&#x27;The original Shakespeare line "keyword">is likely:') "keyword">for match "keyword">in matching_candidates: print(f&#x27; "{match["line"]}"') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ö†Ô∏è No perfect matches found "keyword">in current database.') print(f&#x27;The original line may require:') print(f&#x27; - More extensive Shakespeare quote database') print(f&#x27; - Online anagram solver tools') print(f&#x27; - Manual rearrangement analysis') print(f&#x27; - Focus on specific plays (especially Hamlet)') print(f&#x27;\n*** COMPREHENSIVE SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***')
üìÑ Output

The phrase "how life turns rotten" might relate to "Something is rotten in the state of Denmark" 4. Try online anagram solvers with the 100-letter string 5. Consider that punctuation and spacing in the original might differ üíæ Comprehensive analysis saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/comprehensive_anagram_analysis.json Summary saved to: workspace_2b3ef98c-cc05-450b-a719-711aee40ac65/anagram_solution_summary.txt === ANALYSIS COMPLETE === ‚ö†Ô∏è No perfect matches found in current database. The original line may require: - More extensive Shakespeare quote database - Online anagram solver tools - Manual rearrangement analysis - Focus on specific plays (especially Hamlet) *** COMPREHENSIVE SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM ANALYSIS COMPLETE ***
developer Code Execution - Plan 02 (Iteration 3)

{name}') # Load the most recent comprehensive analysis comprehensive_file = "keyword">None "keyword">for name, path "keyword">in analysis_files: "keyword">if &#x27;comprehensive' "keyword">in Safely inspect JSON structure first "keyword">with open(comprehensive_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: content = f.read() print(f&#x27;File size: {len(content):,} characters') # Parse JSON "keyword">and inspect keys f.seek(0) analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f&#x27;‚úÖ JSON loaded successfully') print(f&#x27;Top-level keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}') # Inspect each key safely "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, str): print(f&#x27; {key}: <string, {len(value)} chars>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: <list, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: <dict, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value)} = {value}') "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå JSON parsing error: {e}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error loading file: {e}') # Extract the anagram data anagram_text = "keyword">None letters_only = "keyword">None letter_frequency = "keyword">None "keyword">if analysis_data: # Try different key names that might contain our anagram data possible_keys = [&#x27;anagram_source', 'anagram_source_text', 'letters_analyzed', 'letters_only'] "keyword">for key "keyword">in possible_keys: "keyword">if key "keyword">in analysis_data: "keyword">if &#x27;source' "keyword">in key: anagram_text = analysis_data[key] print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ Found anagram source: {key}') print(f&#x27;Text: "{anagram_text}"') "keyword">elif &#x27;letters' "keyword">in key: letters_only = analysis_data[key] print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ Found letters sequence: {key}') print(f&#x27;Letters: "{letters_only}"') "keyword">if &#x27;letter_frequency' "keyword">in analysis_data: letter_frequency = analysis_data[&#x27;letter_frequency'] print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ Found letter frequency data') # If we don't have the data, use the known text "keyword">from HISTORY "keyword">if "keyword">not anagram_text "keyword">or "keyword">not letters_only: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Using fallback anagram data "keyword">from HISTORY:') anagram_text = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" clean_text = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', anagram_text) letters_only = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_text).upper() letter_frequency = dict(Counter(letters_only)) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ WORKING WITH ANAGRAM DATA:') print(f&#x27;Source: "{anagram_text}"') print(f&#x27;Letters: "{letters_only}"') print(f&#x27;Total letters: {len(letters_only)}') print(f&#x27;Letter frequency: {letter_frequency}') # Now let's "keyword">try a more focused approach on famous Hamlet quotes print(f&#x27;\nüé≠ FOCUSED HAMLET QUOTE ANALYSIS:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Since the anagram mentions Hamlet, focusing on famous Hamlet soliloquies...') # Most famous Hamlet quotes "keyword">with exact text hamlet_quotes = [ &#x27;To be "keyword">or "keyword">not to be that "keyword">is the question', &#x27;Whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer', &#x27;The slings "keyword">and arrows of outrageous fortune', &#x27;Or to take arms against a sea of troubles', &#x27;And by opposing end them to die to sleep', &#x27;No more "keyword">and by a sleep to say we end', &#x27;The heartache "keyword">and the thousand natural shocks', &#x27;That flesh "keyword">is heir to tis a consummation', &#x27;Devoutly to be wished to die to sleep', &#x27;To sleep perchance to dream ay theres the rub', &#x27;For "keyword">in that sleep of death what dreams may come', &#x27;When we have shuffled off this mortal coil', &#x27;Must give us pause theres the respect', &#x27;That makes calamity of so long life', &#x27;For who would bear the whips "keyword">and scorns of time', &#x27;The oppressors wrong the proud mans contumely', &#x27;The pangs of despised love the laws delay', &#x27;The insolence of office "keyword">and the spurns', &#x27;That patient merit of the unworthy takes', &#x27;When he himself might his quietus make', &#x27;With a bare bodkin who would fardels bear', &#x27;To grunt "keyword">and sweat under a weary life', &#x27;But that the dread of something after death', &#x27;The undiscovered country "keyword">from whose bourn', &#x27;No traveler returns puzzles the will', &#x27;And makes us rather bear those ills we have', &#x27;Than fly to others that we know "keyword">not of', &#x27;Thus conscience does make cowards of us all', &#x27;And thus the native hue of resolution', &#x27;Is sicklied oer "keyword">with the pale cast of thought', &#x27;And enterprises of great pith "keyword">and moment', &#x27;With this regard their currents turn awry', &#x27;And lose the name of action' ] print(f&#x27;Testing {len(hamlet_quotes)} specific Hamlet quotes...') best_matches = [] target_letters = Counter(letters_only) "keyword">for i, quote "keyword">in enumerate(hamlet_quotes, 1): clean_quote = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', quote) quote_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_quote).upper() quote_counter = Counter(quote_letters) print(f&#x27;\n{i:2d}. "{quote}"') print(f&#x27; Length: {len(quote_letters)} (target: {len(letters_only)})') "keyword">if quote_counter == target_letters: print(f&#x27; *** PERFECT ANAGRAM MATCH! ***') best_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': quote, &#x27;type': 'perfect', &#x27;score': 1.0 }) "keyword">elif len(quote_letters) == len(letters_only): # Same length - calculate similarity common = sum((target_letters & quote_counter).values()) similarity = common / len(letters_only) print(f&#x27; Same length, similarity: {similarity:.1%}') "keyword">if similarity > 0.7: best_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': quote, &#x27;type': 'same_length', &#x27;score': similarity }) # Show differences missing = target_letters - quote_counter extra = quote_counter - target_letters "keyword">if missing: print(f&#x27; Missing: {dict(missing)}') "keyword">if extra: print(f&#x27; Extra: {dict(extra)}') # Try combining consecutive Hamlet quotes print(f&#x27;\nüîó TESTING COMBINED HAMLET QUOTES:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Testing combinations of consecutive Hamlet lines...') combination_matches = [] "keyword">for i "keyword">in range(len(hamlet_quotes) - 1): "keyword">for j "keyword">in range(i + 1, min(i + 4, len(hamlet_quotes))): # Test up to 3 consecutive quotes combined = &#x27; '.join(hamlet_quotes[i:j+1]) clean_combined = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', combined) combined_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_combined).upper() combined_counter = Counter(combined_letters) "keyword">if len(combined_letters) > 120: # Skip "keyword">if too long "keyword">break "keyword">if combined_counter == target_letters: print(f&#x27;\n*** PERFECT COMBINATION MATCH! ***') print(f&#x27;Lines {i+1}-{j+1}: "{combined}"') combination_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': combined, &#x27;lines': f'{i+1}-{j+1}', &#x27;type': 'perfect_combination', &#x27;score': 1.0 }) "keyword">elif len(combined_letters) == len(letters_only): common = sum((target_letters & combined_counter).values()) similarity = common / len(letters_only) "keyword">if similarity > 0.8: print(f&#x27;\nHigh similarity combination ({similarity:.1%})') print(f&#x27;Lines {i+1}-{j+1}: "{combined[:80]}..."') combination_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': combined, &#x27;lines': f'{i+1}-{j+1}', &#x27;type': 'similar_combination', &#x27;score': similarity }) # Try manual anagram approach "keyword">for most likely candidates print(f&#x27;\nüß© MANUAL ANAGRAM VERIFICATION:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Manually checking "keyword">if key phrases can be formed...') # Key phrases to look "keyword">for key_phrases = [ &#x27;TO BE OR NOT TO BE', &#x27;THAT IS THE QUESTION', &#x27;WHETHER TIS NOBLER', &#x27;IN THE MIND TO SUFFER', &#x27;THE SLINGS AND ARROWS', &#x27;OUTRAGEOUS FORTUNE', &#x27;SOMETHING IS ROTTEN', &#x27;IN THE STATE OF DENMARK' ] print(&#x27;Checking "keyword">if key Shakespeare phrases can be formed "keyword">from available letters:') available = Counter(letters_only) "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in key_phrases: phrase_clean = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z]', '', phrase) phrase_counter = Counter(phrase_clean) can_form = all(available[letter] >= count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in phrase_counter.items()) print(f&#x27; "{phrase}": {"‚úì" "keyword">if can_form "keyword">else "‚úó"}') "keyword">if can_form: # Show remaining letters after using this phrase remaining = available - phrase_counter remaining_str = &#x27;'.join(letter * count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in remaining.items()) print(f&#x27; Remaining letters ({len(remaining_str)}): {remaining_str[:50]}...') # Summary of findings print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ ANALYSIS RESULTS SUMMARY:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) all_matches = best_matches + combination_matches all_matches.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;score'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Total matches found: {len(all_matches)}') "keyword">if all_matches: print(&#x27;\n*** TOP MATCHES ***') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(all_matches[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {match["type"].upper()} (score: {match["score"]:,.1%})') quote_preview = match["quote"][:80] + &#x27;...' "keyword">if len(match["quote"]) > 80 "keyword">else match["quote"] print(f&#x27; "{quote_preview}"') "keyword">if &#x27;lines' "keyword">in match: print(f&#x27; (Hamlet lines: {match["lines"]})') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è No direct matches found "keyword">in Hamlet quotes.') print(&#x27;The original line may be:') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ From a different Shakespeare play') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ A less famous Hamlet quote "keyword">not "keyword">in our database') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Requires manual anagram solving tools') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Has different punctuation/formatting') # Save targeted analysis results targeted_results = { &#x27;anagram_source': anagram_text, &#x27;letters_sequence': letters_only, &#x27;total_letters': len(letters_only), &#x27;hamlet_quotes_tested': len(hamlet_quotes), &#x27;combination_tests': 'consecutive_lines', &#x27;perfect_matches': [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in all_matches "keyword">if m['score'] == 1.0], &#x27;high_similarity_matches': [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in all_matches "keyword">if m['score'] >= 0.8], &#x27;key_phrases_analysis': key_phrases, &#x27;recommendation': 'Use external anagram solver "keyword">with 100-letter string' "keyword">if "keyword">not all_matches "keyword">else 'Check perfect matches "keyword">for solution' } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/targeted_anagram_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(targeted_results, f, indent=2) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ Targeted analysis saved to: workspace/targeted_anagram_analysis.json') # Create final recommendation "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/anagram_solution_recommendation.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(&#x27;SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM SOLUTION RECOMMENDATION\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 55 + '\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;ANAGRAM TO SOLVE:\n') f.write(f&#x27;"{anagram_text}"\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;100-LETTER SEQUENCE:\n') f.write(f&#x27;{letters_only}\n\n') "keyword">if all_matches: f.write(f&#x27;POTENTIAL SOLUTIONS FOUND:\n') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(all_matches[:3], 1): f.write(f&#x27;{i}. {match["quote"]} (confidence: {match["score"]:,.1%})\n') f.write(&#x27;\n') f.write(&#x27;NEXT STEPS:\n') "keyword">if all_matches: f.write(&#x27;1. Verify the top matches by manual letter counting\n') f.write(&#x27;2. Check original Shakespeare texts "keyword">for exact formatting\n') f.write(&#x27;3. Consider punctuation variations "keyword">in the original\n') "keyword">else: f.write(&#x27;1. Use online anagram solver (e.g., anagram-solver.net)\n') f.write(&#x27;2. Input the 100-letter string "keyword">for automated solving\n') f.write(&#x27;3. Filter results "keyword">for Shakespeare quotes\n') f.write(&#x27;4. Focus on Hamlet "keyword">or other major tragedies\n') print(f&#x27;Recommendation saved to: workspace/anagram_solution_recommendation.txt') print(f&#x27;\n=== TARGETED ANAGRAM ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===') "keyword">if all_matches: perfect_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in all_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;score'] == 1.0] "keyword">if perfect_matches: print(f&#x27;‚úÖ Found {len(perfect_matches)} perfect match(es)!') print(&#x27;The original Shakespeare line "keyword">is likely:') "keyword">for match "keyword">in perfect_matches: print(f&#x27; "{match["quote"]}"') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(all_matches)} partial match(es) but no perfect solution.') print(&#x27;Manual verification "keyword">or external tools may be needed.') tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 00:12:24

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and performed a focused analysis specifically targeting Hamlet quotes and combinations. The script successfully loaded previous analysis data, extracted the 100-letter sequence, and tested 33 individual Hamlet quotes plus consecutive line combinations. Found one high similarity combination (98.0%) with 'To be or not to be that is the question Whether tis nobler in the mind to suffer...' but no perfect anagram matches. The analysis confirmed that common Shakespeare phrases like 'TO BE OR NOT TO BE' and 'THAT IS THE QUESTION' can be formed from the available letters. **PLAN** alignment: 90% complete - comprehensive targeted analysis conducted with focus on Hamlet as suggested by the anagram content, but the exact original line still requires identification. The code properly saved targeted analysis results and created recommendation files. The 100-letter string analysis is thorough, but the solution may require external anagram solving tools or access to less common Shakespeare lines not in the current database. Recommend using online anagram solvers with the confirmed 100-letter sequence: 'INONEOFTHEBARDSBESTTHOUGHTOFTRAGEDIESAREINSISTENTHEROHAMLETQUERIESONTWOFRONTSABOUTHOWLIFETURNSROTTEN'.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import re "keyword">from collections "keyword">import Counter "keyword">import itertools "keyword">from math "keyword">import factorial print(&#x27;=== TARGETED SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM GENERATION ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Generate specific anagram patterns to find the original Shakespeare line') print() # First, let's safely inspect the workspace to understand what analysis we have print(&#x27;üìÅ INSPECTING WORKSPACE STRUCTURE:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) workspace_files = [] analysis_files = [] "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for item "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): item_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', item) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(item_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(item_path) workspace_files.append((item, item_path, file_size)) print(f&#x27; üìÑ {item} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Identify analysis files "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in item.lower() "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;anagram', 'analysis', 'comprehensive']): analysis_files.append((item, item_path)) print(f&#x27; üéØ Analysis file detected') "keyword">elif os.path.isdir(item_path): print(f&#x27; üìÅ {item}/') "keyword">for subitem "keyword">in os.listdir(item_path): subitem_path = os.path.join(item_path, subitem) "keyword">if os.path.isfile(subitem_path): subfile_size = os.path.getsize(subitem_path) workspace_files.append((f&#x27;{item}/{subitem}', subitem_path, subfile_size)) print(f&#x27; üìÑ {subitem} ({subfile_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in subitem.lower() "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;anagram', 'analysis', 'comprehensive']): analysis_files.append((f&#x27;{item}/{subitem}', subitem_path)) print(f&#x27; üéØ Analysis file detected') print(f&#x27;\nüìä FOUND {len(analysis_files)} ANALYSIS FILES:') "keyword">for name, path "keyword">in analysis_files: print(f&#x27; ‚Ä¢ {name}') # Load the most recent comprehensive analysis comprehensive_file = "keyword">None "keyword">for name, path "keyword">in analysis_files: "keyword">if &#x27;comprehensive' "keyword">in name.lower(): comprehensive_file = path "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not comprehensive_file: # Fall back to any analysis file comprehensive_file = analysis_files[0][1] "keyword">if analysis_files "keyword">else "keyword">None analysis_data = "keyword">None "keyword">if comprehensive_file: print(f&#x27;\nüìà LOADING ANALYSIS DATA:') print(f&#x27;File: {comprehensive_file}') # Safely inspect JSON structure first "keyword">with open(comprehensive_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: "keyword">try: content = f.read() print(f&#x27;File size: {len(content):,} characters') # Parse JSON "keyword">and inspect keys f.seek(0) analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f&#x27;‚úÖ JSON loaded successfully') print(f&#x27;Top-level keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}') # Inspect each key safely "keyword">for key, value "keyword">in analysis_data.items(): "keyword">if isinstance(value, str): print(f&#x27; {key}: <string, {len(value)} chars>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, list): print(f&#x27; {key}: <list, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f&#x27; {key}: <dict, {len(value)} items>') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; {key}: {type(value)} = {value}') "keyword">except json.JSONDecodeError "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå JSON parsing error: {e}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error loading file: {e}') # Extract the anagram data anagram_text = "keyword">None letters_only = "keyword">None letter_frequency = "keyword">None "keyword">if analysis_data: # Try different key names that might contain our anagram data possible_keys = [&#x27;anagram_source', 'anagram_source_text', 'letters_analyzed', 'letters_only'] "keyword">for key "keyword">in possible_keys: "keyword">if key "keyword">in analysis_data: "keyword">if &#x27;source' "keyword">in key: anagram_text = analysis_data[key] print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ Found anagram source: {key}') print(f&#x27;Text: "{anagram_text}"') "keyword">elif &#x27;letters' "keyword">in key: letters_only = analysis_data[key] print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ Found letters sequence: {key}') print(f&#x27;Letters: "{letters_only}"') "keyword">if &#x27;letter_frequency' "keyword">in analysis_data: letter_frequency = analysis_data[&#x27;letter_frequency'] print(f&#x27;\n‚úÖ Found letter frequency data') # If we don't have the data, use the known text "keyword">from HISTORY "keyword">if "keyword">not anagram_text "keyword">or "keyword">not letters_only: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è Using fallback anagram data "keyword">from HISTORY:') anagram_text = ""keyword">in one of The Bard&#x27;s best thought of tragedies are insistent hero Hamlet queries on two fronts about how life turns rotten" clean_text = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', anagram_text) letters_only = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_text).upper() letter_frequency = dict(Counter(letters_only)) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ WORKING WITH ANAGRAM DATA:') print(f&#x27;Source: "{anagram_text}"') print(f&#x27;Letters: "{letters_only}"') print(f&#x27;Total letters: {len(letters_only)}') print(f&#x27;Letter frequency: {letter_frequency}') # Now let's "keyword">try a more focused approach on famous Hamlet quotes print(f&#x27;\nüé≠ FOCUSED HAMLET QUOTE ANALYSIS:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Since the anagram mentions Hamlet, focusing on famous Hamlet soliloquies...') # Most famous Hamlet quotes "keyword">with exact text hamlet_quotes = [ &#x27;To be "keyword">or "keyword">not to be that "keyword">is the question', &#x27;Whether tis nobler "keyword">in the mind to suffer', &#x27;The slings "keyword">and arrows of outrageous fortune', &#x27;Or to take arms against a sea of troubles', &#x27;And by opposing end them to die to sleep', &#x27;No more "keyword">and by a sleep to say we end', &#x27;The heartache "keyword">and the thousand natural shocks', &#x27;That flesh "keyword">is heir to tis a consummation', &#x27;Devoutly to be wished to die to sleep', &#x27;To sleep perchance to dream ay theres the rub', &#x27;For "keyword">in that sleep of death what dreams may come', &#x27;When we have shuffled off this mortal coil', &#x27;Must give us pause theres the respect', &#x27;That makes calamity of so long life', &#x27;For who would bear the whips "keyword">and scorns of time', &#x27;The oppressors wrong the proud mans contumely', &#x27;The pangs of despised love the laws delay', &#x27;The insolence of office "keyword">and the spurns', &#x27;That patient merit of the unworthy takes', &#x27;When he himself might his quietus make', &#x27;With a bare bodkin who would fardels bear', &#x27;To grunt "keyword">and sweat under a weary life', &#x27;But that the dread of something after death', &#x27;The undiscovered country "keyword">from whose bourn', &#x27;No traveler returns puzzles the will', &#x27;And makes us rather bear those ills we have', &#x27;Than fly to others that we know "keyword">not of', &#x27;Thus conscience does make cowards of us all', &#x27;And thus the native hue of resolution', &#x27;Is sicklied oer "keyword">with the pale cast of thought', &#x27;And enterprises of great pith "keyword">and moment', &#x27;With this regard their currents turn awry', &#x27;And lose the name of action' ] print(f&#x27;Testing {len(hamlet_quotes)} specific Hamlet quotes...') best_matches = [] target_letters = Counter(letters_only) "keyword">for i, quote "keyword">in enumerate(hamlet_quotes, 1): clean_quote = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', quote) quote_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_quote).upper() quote_counter = Counter(quote_letters) print(f&#x27;\n{i:2d}. "{quote}"') print(f&#x27; Length: {len(quote_letters)} (target: {len(letters_only)})') "keyword">if quote_counter == target_letters: print(f&#x27; *** PERFECT ANAGRAM MATCH! ***') best_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': quote, &#x27;type': 'perfect', &#x27;score': 1.0 }) "keyword">elif len(quote_letters) == len(letters_only): # Same length - calculate similarity common = sum((target_letters & quote_counter).values()) similarity = common / len(letters_only) print(f&#x27; Same length, similarity: {similarity:.1%}') "keyword">if similarity > 0.7: best_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': quote, &#x27;type': 'same_length', &#x27;score': similarity }) # Show differences missing = target_letters - quote_counter extra = quote_counter - target_letters "keyword">if missing: print(f&#x27; Missing: {dict(missing)}') "keyword">if extra: print(f&#x27; Extra: {dict(extra)}') # Try combining consecutive Hamlet quotes print(f&#x27;\nüîó TESTING COMBINED HAMLET QUOTES:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Testing combinations of consecutive Hamlet lines...') combination_matches = [] "keyword">for i "keyword">in range(len(hamlet_quotes) - 1): "keyword">for j "keyword">in range(i + 1, min(i + 4, len(hamlet_quotes))): # Test up to 3 consecutive quotes combined = &#x27; '.join(hamlet_quotes[i:j+1]) clean_combined = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z\s]', '', combined) combined_letters = re.sub(r&#x27;\s+', '', clean_combined).upper() combined_counter = Counter(combined_letters) "keyword">if len(combined_letters) > 120: # Skip "keyword">if too long "keyword">break "keyword">if combined_counter == target_letters: print(f&#x27;\n*** PERFECT COMBINATION MATCH! ***') print(f&#x27;Lines {i+1}-{j+1}: "{combined}"') combination_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': combined, &#x27;lines': f'{i+1}-{j+1}', &#x27;type': 'perfect_combination', &#x27;score': 1.0 }) "keyword">elif len(combined_letters) == len(letters_only): common = sum((target_letters & combined_counter).values()) similarity = common / len(letters_only) "keyword">if similarity > 0.8: print(f&#x27;\nHigh similarity combination ({similarity:.1%})') print(f&#x27;Lines {i+1}-{j+1}: "{combined[:80]}..."') combination_matches.append({ &#x27;quote': combined, &#x27;lines': f'{i+1}-{j+1}', &#x27;type': 'similar_combination', &#x27;score': similarity }) # Try manual anagram approach "keyword">for most likely candidates print(f&#x27;\nüß© MANUAL ANAGRAM VERIFICATION:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) print(&#x27;Manually checking "keyword">if key phrases can be formed...') # Key phrases to look "keyword">for key_phrases = [ &#x27;TO BE OR NOT TO BE', &#x27;THAT IS THE QUESTION', &#x27;WHETHER TIS NOBLER', &#x27;IN THE MIND TO SUFFER', &#x27;THE SLINGS AND ARROWS', &#x27;OUTRAGEOUS FORTUNE', &#x27;SOMETHING IS ROTTEN', &#x27;IN THE STATE OF DENMARK' ] print(&#x27;Checking "keyword">if key Shakespeare phrases can be formed "keyword">from available letters:') available = Counter(letters_only) "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in key_phrases: phrase_clean = re.sub(r&#x27;[^a-zA-Z]', '', phrase) phrase_counter = Counter(phrase_clean) can_form = all(available[letter] >= count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in phrase_counter.items()) print(f&#x27; "{phrase}": {"‚úì" "keyword">if can_form "keyword">else "‚úó"}') "keyword">if can_form: # Show remaining letters after using this phrase remaining = available - phrase_counter remaining_str = &#x27;'.join(letter * count "keyword">for letter, count "keyword">in remaining.items()) print(f&#x27; Remaining letters ({len(remaining_str)}): {remaining_str[:50]}...') # Summary of findings print(f&#x27;\nüèÜ ANALYSIS RESULTS SUMMARY:') print(&#x27;=' * 50) all_matches = best_matches + combination_matches all_matches.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;score'], reverse="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Total matches found: {len(all_matches)}') "keyword">if all_matches: print(&#x27;\n*** TOP MATCHES ***') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(all_matches[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {match["type"].upper()} (score: {match["score"]:,.1%})') quote_preview = match["quote"][:80] + &#x27;...' "keyword">if len(match["quote"]) > 80 "keyword">else match["quote"] print(f&#x27; "{quote_preview}"') "keyword">if &#x27;lines' "keyword">in match: print(f&#x27; (Hamlet lines: {match["lines"]})') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö†Ô∏è No direct matches found "keyword">in Hamlet quotes.') print(&#x27;The original line may be:') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ From a different Shakespeare play') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ A less famous Hamlet quote "keyword">not "keyword">in our database') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Requires manual anagram solving tools') print(&#x27; ‚Ä¢ Has different punctuation/formatting') # Save targeted analysis results targeted_results = { &#x27;anagram_source': anagram_text, &#x27;letters_sequence': letters_only, &#x27;total_letters': len(letters_only), &#x27;hamlet_quotes_tested': len(hamlet_quotes), &#x27;combination_tests': 'consecutive_lines', &#x27;perfect_matches': [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in all_matches "keyword">if m['score'] == 1.0], &#x27;high_similarity_matches': [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in all_matches "keyword">if m['score'] >= 0.8], &#x27;key_phrases_analysis': key_phrases, &#x27;recommendation': 'Use external anagram solver "keyword">with 100-letter string' "keyword">if "keyword">not all_matches "keyword">else 'Check perfect matches "keyword">for solution' } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/targeted_anagram_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(targeted_results, f, indent=2) print(f&#x27;\nüíæ Targeted analysis saved to: workspace/targeted_anagram_analysis.json') # Create final recommendation "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/anagram_solution_recommendation.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(&#x27;SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM SOLUTION RECOMMENDATION\n') f.write(&#x27;=' * 55 + '\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;ANAGRAM TO SOLVE:\n') f.write(f&#x27;"{anagram_text}"\n\n') f.write(f&#x27;100-LETTER SEQUENCE:\n') f.write(f&#x27;{letters_only}\n\n') "keyword">if all_matches: f.write(f&#x27;POTENTIAL SOLUTIONS FOUND:\n') "keyword">for i, match "keyword">in enumerate(all_matches[:3], 1): f.write(f&#x27;{i}. {match["quote"]} (confidence: {match["score"]:,.1%})\n') f.write(&#x27;\n') f.write(&#x27;NEXT STEPS:\n') "keyword">if all_matches: f.write(&#x27;1. Verify the top matches by manual letter counting\n') f.write(&#x27;2. Check original Shakespeare texts "keyword">for exact formatting\n') f.write(&#x27;3. Consider punctuation variations "keyword">in the original\n') "keyword">else: f.write(&#x27;1. Use online anagram solver (e.g., anagram-solver.net)\n') f.write(&#x27;2. Input the 100-letter string "keyword">for automated solving\n') f.write(&#x27;3. Filter results "keyword">for Shakespeare quotes\n') f.write(&#x27;4. Focus on Hamlet "keyword">or other major tragedies\n') print(f&#x27;Recommendation saved to: workspace/anagram_solution_recommendation.txt') print(f&#x27;\n=== TARGETED ANAGRAM ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===') "keyword">if all_matches: perfect_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in all_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;score'] == 1.0] "keyword">if perfect_matches: print(f&#x27;‚úÖ Found {len(perfect_matches)} perfect match(es)!') print(&#x27;The original Shakespeare line "keyword">is likely:') "keyword">for match "keyword">in perfect_matches: print(f&#x27; "{match["quote"]}"') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(all_matches)} partial match(es) but no perfect solution.') print(&#x27;Manual verification "keyword">or external tools may be needed.') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No matches found "keyword">in targeted Hamlet analysis.') print(&#x27;Recommend using external anagram solving tools.') print(&#x27;\n*** SHAKESPEARE ANAGRAM GENERATION COMPLETE ***')
